unnormalised: Donating to charity is a great way to give back, isn't it? You know, make a difference. I've been thinking a lot about it lately, especially with all the talk about helping those in need. You see appeals everywhere, asking for everything from Rs. 50 to Rs. 5000, or even more, depending on the cause.

unnormalised: One thing that always confuses me is how much to give. Like, is Rs. 100 enough? Or should I be aiming for Rs. 1000 or even Rs. 10000? I mean, every little bit helps, right? unnormalised: Then there's the whole thing about finding the right charity. There are so many out there, and you want to make sure your money is actually going where it's supposed to. I remember reading an article about a scam where only 10% of the donated funds actually reached the beneficiaries. Scary stuff! Makes you wanna stick with the big names, like maybe donating ₹2000 to CRY or the Akshaya Patra Foundation. They seem legit.
